values: It is sad that this place isn't like it once was. Where is the drama, man? The passion? Are we all that boring that we don't like to communicate anymore? Or is everyone blocking me out? Should I be mad? I am mad! How dare all of you form a secret society! My god, son!

My god is school ever more like school. Funny that! Anthony discovered tentacle porn, but alas there was no sharing. Not that I like porn! Oh no, it is for dirty little boys, not for updstanding gentleman, nor for me, because I cannot allow myself to be an upstanding gentleman, for that would take all the fun out of life. Alas once more.

I am building a volcano. Lisa is great.

Did anyone else feel that the feast was missing a little huzzah this year? Well, I certainly did. I pondered long and hard to figure out what it was. And then I realised. There was no spotted dick. My god, my life is ruined.

<lj-cut text="Private to Ginny">

I am indeed most disheartened not to have seen you since returning to school. Would you like to share tales over some spotted dick?

</lj-cut>
<lj-cut text="Private to Lisa"> 
Would you like to make some volcanoes together? I would be so ever delighted.
I really am a GOD among men.

So I said to the girl, I really like your hat, and so she asked me, what is that? A cat? A hat? For the life of me I know not!

To cake! The cake! I want cake! 

Mother, where do you hide?

Red heads are dangerous! They bite! The hat needs to be remeasured! With what, dear Henry? A bucket? Not I, said the goose! The hen shall have to bake the bread herself, over Frodo's dead body!

Hello all!

Isn't the sun sparkling? I feel we should all drink and celebrate the end of a race! Who won? I wasn't watching!

I went to the hospital wing today, because Ginny asked me too. Madam Pomfrey, the minx, was really quite full on.

I have a question for you all! Red? Or mice?

<lj-cut text="Private to Ginny">

To Ginny: We're still friends aren't we? I hope so.
</lj-cut>
<lj-cut text="Private to Self">

To Self: Mark this day as the day you fucked yourself up six ways from Sunday. And also the day that you woke up face first in vomit without falling alseep. Accomplishments abound!

I do hope everybody is behaving themselves. Otherwise, there will be naught but coal for Christmas.

<lj-cut text="Private to Work Group People">

Private to Work Group People: Seeing as none of us seem terribly interested in doing the assignment, I have allocated myself the job of allocating jobs.

There will be a meeting in the library during lunch tomorrow. I have handouts and schedules for everybody. I'm afraid if you do not turn up, I will have no choice but to assign you with the task of telling either Professor Lupin or Professor Weasley why you have decided to be completely disinterested in passing.
</lj-cut>

<lj-cut text="Private to Ginny">

Private to Ginny: I hope you are feeling a trifle bit better. Do you want to do something, later? Become snowmen, or perhaps flowers?

</lj-cut>

<lj-cut text="Private to Mandy">

Private to Mandy: Perhaps we ought to have a Ravenclaw meeting. Keep everyone calm and well informed that nothing is in fact going on, that we know of. Also to give the younger children a chance to speak up, and offer them some form of comfort.

I'll see Flitwick if you want to start informing people that we are more likely than not going to gather in the common room after dinner.

</lj-cut>

<lj-cut text="Private to Hermione">

Your sparkle isn't as sparkly as it should be. Would you like some cake with sprinkles? It may sparkle you up! I have just received another large cake from my Mother, and cannot possibly eat it on my own. I am withering away without your company. 

I also have a few questions to ask you about the Transfiguration homework. My housemates have reached a dead end in question 3b, and perhaps you could shed some light on the situation.

This is an invitation to ALL. (Well, to those in third year and above, so not really all but most!) There is a Hogsmeade weekend upon us, and I press you all to attend.

There will be a gathering of students at the Three Broomsticks having an IMMENSELY FABULOUS time. The first two drinks will be paid for by none other than your host Michael Corner. 

SO, if you are planning to attend, please leave a comment so I can arrange to have our table booked in advance.

As always, my life is so interesting that I cannot ever seem to think of anything to write here. Perhaps I should bore you all with some lovely babble about none other than myself.

I've been having odd dreams lately. They are very full of colour and crying babies, and after talking to the Divination 'expert' I have realised that they mean nothing. Except that I am insane, but that is of no surprise.

I tripped down a set of stairs this morning, much to my amusement and all those around, but now my head is throbbing and I seem to have developed bruises all over my wrists. When I push them, they change from a red purple to a black, which is surprising. 

You may not be able to tell, but I am in fact quite bored. You can only compare charts for so long before the colours start to blend in together, and my life is so full of colour recently what with the bruises and the dreams.

<lj-cut text="Private to Self">

You are an idiot. Go to sleep.
WHO TOOK 'TRIUMPH OF THE BRA?' I HAD THREE CHAPTERS LEFT! TERRY????

WHY WAS MY JOURNAL IN THE SECOND YEAR'S DORMITORY? AND WHY IS THERE PINK LOVE HEARTS EVERYWHERE TERRY'S NAME IS MENTIONED? AND AROUND MINE?

WHO DID THIS? DO YOU HATE ME THAT MUCH?

Well, yesterday was eventful:

- Cheering charms
- Strip poker
- Flirting
- Probably copious amounts of groping
- A duel
- Near death experiences

And much fun was had by all?

Library. Come back. I miss you.

With renewed vigor, I have discovered life again.

Everyone is invited to Ravenclaw dorms to play cards!

I have not died, I'm afraid. Quite alive, kicking and extremely tired. Perhaps I will never learn my lesson when it comes to taking on so much that you forget that there is a life outside of the library. But, perhaps I have been decieved and there really isn't anything outside of books and study. 

I really need to get out more.

Entertain me, my minions!

Now that Terry and Anthony have gone back to their original coloured hair, I feel that there is something missing from my life. Everything looks so bleak, I do not know how I will face the day. 

The Masquerade Ball is coming up. I do think that stagging would be much less embarrassing than asking anyone to go. 

<lj-cut text="Private to Self">

Should I ask Ginny? I feel that a list is the best way to decide this.

Pros:                            
She could say yes.               

Cons:

She could say no.

Why do I feel as if this didn't help?

It is a lovely day to be alive. The butter was passed to me this morning (thanks so much Anthony) and I have finished my extra credit assignment with Flitwick. 

I am sure you were all desperate to know this. 

<lj-cut text="Private to Ginny">

I cannot for the life of me finish my letter to my Mother. Scarred for life.

Still up for Thursday?

Teachers always recommend to not take up another class when you go into your 6th year. However, they seemed to be really happy for me to take this up.

So. Hey, I'm Michael. Feel free to stay up and say something about yourself, so I can identify you by that.
